alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Stokes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Stokes, northwestern Rockingham, southwestern Pittsylvania, Henry and southeastern Patrick Counties and the City of Martinsville through 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Fieldale to near King. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eden... Martinsville... Mayodan... Madison... Walnut Cove... Stoneville... and Danbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
